recipes.title: BBQ Feta and Hot Banana Pepper Turkey Burgers

winePairing.pairingText: Turkey Burgers works really well with Malbec, Merlot, and Zinfandel. Merlot will be perfectly adequate for a classic burger with standard toppings. Bolder toppings call for bolder wines, such as a malbec or peppery zinfandel. The Terrazas de los Andes Reserva Malbec with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 22 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Terrazas de los Andes Reserva Malbec
productMatches.description: Bright red color with purple shades. Intense floral and fruity notes. Presence of violets, ripe black cherry and plum aromas. ReIts sweet and juicy mouthfeel delivers finesse, delicate tannins and an elegant finish of black fruits. veals a toasty and spicy character of black pepper and chocolate.Pair with Tuna Carpaccio and Red Fruits Vinaigrette, Tenderloin served with MediterraneanRatatouille and Moist Semisweet Chocolate Cake over Mascarpone and Red Fruits Ice Cream.

recipes.instructions: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat.                            In a bowl, mix the turkey, peppers, and feta cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Form the mixture into 4 patties.                            Cook patties about 8 minutes per side on the prepared grill, to an internal temperature of 180 degrees F (85 degrees C).                                                Kitchen-Friendly View

steps.step: Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat.
In a bowl, mix the turkey, peppers, and feta cheese. Season with salt and pepper. Form the mixture into 4 patties.
Cook patties about 8 minutes per side on the prepared grill, to an internal temperature of 180 degrees F (85 degrees C).
